title: Akivis algebra
summary: In mathematics, and in particular the study of algebra, an Akivis algebra is a nonassociative algebra equipped with a binary operator, the commutator [ x , y ] {\displaystyle [x,y]} and a ternary operator, the associator [ x , y , z ] {\displaystyle [x,y,z]} that satisfy a particular relationship known as the Akivis identity. They are named in honour of Russian mathematician Maks A. Akivis.
